intro: Conanthera trimaculata, commonly known as the three-spotted bladderpod, is a flowering plant native to the southern United States. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes many other mustard family plants. The plant is characterized by its small, showy white or pink flowers and hairy, lobed leaves. It produces distinctive seed pods that are inflated and contain numerous tiny seeds. Conanthera trimaculata is often found in dry, open habitats such as prairies and woodlands.
